<EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;We had revenues of $29,183&nbsp;million in 2016, $32,735&nbsp;million in 2015 and $45,608&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Revenues decreased by $3,552&nbsp;million, or 11%, in 2016 compared to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Lower average sales prices driven by decreases in the prices of crude oil and other feedstocks led to revenue declines of 10% in 2016.
	Lower sales volumes in our Refining segment due to turnaround activities and unplanned outages, which were substantially offset by higher I&amp;D segment sales volumes, led to a 1% volume-driven decline in revenues. The decline in revenues includes
	a $290&nbsp;million impact from the sale of our wholly owned Argentine subsidiary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Revenues
	decreased $12,873&nbsp;million, or 28%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The decline in prices for crude oil and other feedstocks
	during 2015 was the primary contributing factor for lower average sales prices, which were responsible for 23% of the revenue decline in 2015 versus 2014. Unfavorable translation impacts resulting from a significant decline in the euro/U.S. dollar
	exchange rate further reduced revenues by 5% during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales volumes during 2015 were relatively unchanged from 2014. A
	decrease in sales due to lower crude processing rates in our Refining segment was mostly offset by higher sales volumes for U.S. and European polyolefins, oxyfuels and related products and intermediate chemicals. Revenues for each of our business
	segments are reviewed further in the &#147;Segment Analysis&#148; section below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Cost of Sales
</B>
	&#151;Cost of sales were
	$23,191&nbsp;million in 2016, $25,683&nbsp;million in 2015 and $38,939&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Fluctuations in our cost of
	sales are generally driven by changes in feedstock and energy costs, as all other material components remain relatively flat from year to year. Feedstock and energy related costs generally represent approximately 75% to 80% of cost of sales, other
	variable costs account for approximately 10% of cost
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	33
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	of sales on an annual basis and fixed operating costs, consisting primarily of expenses associated with employee compensation, depreciation and amortization, and maintenance, range from
	approximately 10% to 15% in each annual period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Cost of sales decreased by $2,492&nbsp;million
	in 2016 compared to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The decrease in cost of sales in 2016 was primarily due to lower feedstock and energy costs. Raw
	material costs for crude oil, heavy liquids and natural gas liquids (&#147;NGLs&#148;) and other feedstocks were lower in 2016 compared to 2015. The sale of our wholly owned Argentine subsidiary in 2016 also contributed approximately
	$230&nbsp;million to the decline in 2016 cost of sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of sales in 2016 and 2015 also included noncash,
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	lower of cost or market (&#147;LCM&#148;) inventory valuation charges totaling $29&nbsp;million and $548&nbsp;million, respectively. The 2016 adjustment is related to a drop in polypropylene prices in our
	O&amp;P&#151;Americas segment and the adjustments in 2015 affected all of our segments except Technology. The 2015 adjustments were driven mainly by declines in the prices for crude oil, ethylene, propylene, benzene and ETBE. During 2015, cost of
	sales also included $35&nbsp;million of amortization expense associated with the expiration of emission allowance credits in our Refining and I&amp;D segments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Cost of sales decreased by $13,256&nbsp;million in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The decrease in cost of sales in 2015 was primarily due to lower feedstock and energy costs. In 2015, the raw material costs for crude oil, heavy liquids and natural gas liquids (&#147;NGLs&#148;) and
	other feedstocks were significantly lower relative to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Cost of sales in 2015 included the $548&nbsp;million pretax LCM
	inventory valuation charge and $35&nbsp;million of amortization expense discussed above. Cost of sales in 2014 included a $760&nbsp;million charge related to an LCM inventory valuation adjustment driven by a decline in feedstock prices in our
	O&amp;P&#151;Americas segment and a $52&nbsp;million benefit in our O&amp;P&#151;EAI segment associated with a settlement for certain existing and future environmental claims under a 2005 indemnification agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Operating Income
</B>
	&#151;Our operating income was $5,060&nbsp;million, $6,122&nbsp;million and $5,736&nbsp;million in 2016, 2015 and
	2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Operating income decreased by $1,062&nbsp;million in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating income for 2016 reflects the impacts of the LCM inventory valuation adjustment discussed above and a $58&nbsp;million pension
	settlement charge. Operating income for 2015 reflects the LCM inventory valuation adjustment and the emission credit allowance amortization discussed above. Including these impacts, 2016 operating income declined relative to 2015 by
	$863&nbsp;million, $243&nbsp;million and $166&nbsp;million in our O&amp;P&#151;Americas, Refining and I&amp;D segments, respectively. These lower results were partially offset by a $185&nbsp;million improvement in operating income for our
	O&amp;P&#151;EAI segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Operating income increased by $386&nbsp;million in 2015, which
	includes the impact of the LCM inventory valuation adjustments, environmental settlement and emission credit allowances amortization discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Including these impacts, operating income in 2015 for our O&amp;P&#151;EAI and Refining segments reflect improvements of $425&nbsp;million and $250&nbsp;million, respectively. These improvements were
	offset in part by a $316&nbsp;million decline in the results of our O&amp;P&#151;Americas segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Operating results for each
	of our business segments are reviewed further in the &#147;Segment Analysis&#148; section below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Interest Expense
</B>
	&#151;Interest expense was $322&nbsp;million in 2016,
	$310&nbsp;million in 2015 and $352&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Debt issuances of our 1.875% guaranteed
	notes due 2022 in March 2016 and our 4.625% senior notes due 2055 in March 2015 and reduced benefits from our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-for-floating
</FONT>
</FONT>
	interest rate swaps resulted in
	$42&nbsp;million of higher interest expense in 2016. This increase was partially offset by a $22&nbsp;million increase in capitalized interest and $7&nbsp;million of lower bank and other fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	The decrease in interest expense in 2015 relative to 2014 was primarily due to favorable impacts of
	$85&nbsp;million related to our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-for-floating
</FONT>
</FONT>
	interest rate swaps and cross-currency swaps. This decrease was offset in part by $46&nbsp;million of higher interest
	charges related to the issuance of our 4.875% guaranteed notes due 2044 in February 2014 and our 4.625% senior notes due 2055 in March 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For additional information related to our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	fixed-for-floating
</FONT>
</FONT>
	interest rate swaps and cross-currency swaps, see Notes 12, 14
	and 15.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Income from Equity Investments
</B>
	&#151;Our income from equity investments was $367&nbsp;million in 2016,
	$339&nbsp;million in 2015 and $257&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	The $28&nbsp;million increase in income
	from equity investments in 2016 is largely due to improved results for our joint ventures in Mexico, Saudi Arabia, Poland and Thailand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Our 2015 income from equity investments increased by $82&nbsp;million over 2014 largely due to improved results from our joint ventures in Poland, Korea and Mexico, offset in
	part by lower results from our joint ventures in Saudi Arabia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Income Taxes&#151;
</B>
	Our effective income tax rates of
	26.5% in 2016, 27.9% in 2015 and 27.0% in 2014 resulted in tax provisions of $1,386&nbsp;million, $1,730&nbsp;million and $1,540&nbsp;million, respectively. Our 2016 income tax provision includes $135&nbsp;million of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	out of period adjustments from prior years, for further information on these adjustments, please see Footnote 18, Income Taxes. Our effective income tax rate fluctuates based on, among other factors,
	changes in pretax income in countries with varying statutory tax rates, the U.S. domestic production activity deduction, changes in valuation allowances, changes in foreign exchange gains/losses, the amount of exempt income, and changes in
	unrecognized tax benefits associated with uncertain tax positions. The Company&#146;s exempt income primarily includes interest income and equity earnings of joint ventures. The interest income is earned by certain of our European subsidiaries
	through intercompany financings and is either untaxed or taxed at rates substantially lower than the U.S. statutory rate. The equity earnings are attributable to our joint ventures and these earnings when paid through dividends to certain European
	subsidiaries are eligible for participation exemptions, which exempt the dividend payments from all or portions of normal statutory income tax rates. We currently anticipate the favorable treatment for the interest income and dividends to continue
	in the near term; however, this treatment is based on current law and tax rulings, which could change. The foreign exchange gains/losses have a permanent impact on our effective income tax rate that can cause unpredictable movement in our effective
	income tax rate. We continue to maintain valuation allowances in various jurisdictions totaling $96&nbsp;million, which could impact our effective tax rate in the future. We believe our effective income tax rate for 2017 will be approximately 27%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016&#151;
</I>
	The 2016 effective income tax rate, which was lower than the U.S. statutory tax rate of 35%, was favorably
	impacted by exempt income
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-6.7%),
</FONT>
	earnings in various countries (notably in Europe) with lower statutory tax rates
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-3.0%),
</FONT>
	the impact of a change in
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-U.S.
</FONT>
	tax law on our deferred tax liabilities
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-1.0%)
</FONT>
	and the U.S. domestic production activity deduction
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-0.8%).
</FONT>
	These favorable
	items were partially offset by the effects of
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	out of period adjustments (2.5%) and U.S. state and local income taxes (0.5%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015&#151;
</I>
	The 2015 effective income tax rate, which was lower than the U.S. statutory
	tax rate of 35%, was favorably impacted by exempt income
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-5.1%),
</FONT>
	earnings in various countries (notably in Europe) with lower statutory tax rates
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-2.1%),
</FONT>
	and the U.S.
	domestic production activity deduction
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-1.4%).
</FONT>
	These favorable items were partially offset by the effects of U.S. state and local income taxes (1.0%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2014
</I>
	&#151;The 2014 effective income tax rate, which was lower than the U.S. statutory tax rate of 35%, was favorably impacted by
	exempt income
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-4.8%),
</FONT>
	the U.S. domestic production activity deduction
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-1.9%),
</FONT>
	foreign exchange losses
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-1.5%),
</FONT>
	and earnings in
	various countries (notably in Europe) with lower statutory tax rates
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	(-1.1%).
</FONT>
	These favorable items were partially offset by the effects of U.S. state and local income taxes (1.1%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For further information related to our income taxes, see Note&nbsp;18 to the Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Comprehensive Income&#151;
</B>
	We had comprehensive income of $3,763&nbsp;million in 2016, $4,064&nbsp;million in 2015 and
	$3,052&nbsp;million in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	In 2016, comprehensive income decreased on lower net income, the
	unfavorable impacts of financial derivative adjustments and the increase in actuarial losses related to our defined benefit pension and other postretirement benefit plans recognized in 2016. These decreases were offset in part by the net favorable
	impact of unrealized net changes in foreign currency translation adjustments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2016, we had a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	gain of $43&nbsp;million related to the effective portion of the unrealized gains of our financial instruments designated as net investment hedges. The cumulative effect of our derivatives designated as cash
	flow hedges in 2016 was a loss of $29&nbsp;million. In 2016, cumulative losses associated with the strengthening of the euro versus the U.S. dollar in the first half of the year resulted in a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	loss of
	$15&nbsp;million related to our cross currency swaps. An unrealized loss of $17&nbsp;million in 2016 related to forward-starting interest rate swaps was driven by decreases in benchmark interest rates during that period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	loss of $63&nbsp;million related to our cross currency swaps was a reclassification
	adjustment included in net income in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2016 and 2015, we recognized net actuarial losses of $188&nbsp;million and
	$8&nbsp;million, respectively. The $188&nbsp;million net loss in 2016 reflects $279&nbsp;million of losses due to pension and other postretirement benefit discount rate decreases, offset by $79&nbsp;million of gains related to pension asset
	experience and $10&nbsp;million due to favorable postretirement liability experience and other immaterial items. In 2015, the $8&nbsp;million net loss was primarily attributable to $133&nbsp;million of actual asset return less than the expected
	return. This loss was offset by gains due to $73&nbsp;million of discount rate increases and, $50&nbsp;million of gains due to favorable liability experience and healthcare assumptions. In 2016, we also recognized a $61&nbsp;million reclassification
	adjustment related primarily to a voluntary lump sum program offered to certain former employees in select U.S. pension plans. Total lump sum payments from these plans exceeded annual service and interest cost in 2016 resulting in this loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	In 2015, Comprehensive income increased on higher net income, the reduction in actuarial losses
	related to our defined benefit pension and other postretirement benefit plans recognized in 2015, the favorable impact of unrealized net changes in foreign currency translation adjustments and to a lesser extent, the benefit of favorable financial
	derivative adjustments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015 and 2014, we recognized net actuarial losses of $8&nbsp;million and $493&nbsp;million,
	respectively. The $493&nbsp;million net loss in the prior year was caused primarily by pension and other postretirement benefit discount rate decreases and mortality assumption changes. In 2015, the $8&nbsp;million net loss was primarily
	attributable to $133&nbsp;million of actual asset return less than the expected return. This loss was offset by gains due to $73&nbsp;million of discount rate increases and, $50&nbsp;million of gains due to favorable liability experience and
	healthcare assumptions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The predominant functional currency for our operations outside of the U.S. is the euro.
	Relative to the U.S. dollar, the value of the euro decreased during 2015 and 2014, resulting in losses as reflected in the Consolidated Statements of Comprehensive Income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015, the cumulative effect of our derivatives designated as cash flow hedges was a gain of $279&nbsp;million. Cumulative gains in 2015 associated with the decline in the euro versus the U.S. dollar
	resulted in a
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	gain of $262&nbsp;million related to our cross currency swaps. A $17&nbsp;million gain in 2015 related to forward-starting interest rate swaps were driven by increases in benchmark
	interest rates during that period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	pre-tax
</FONT>
	loss of $207&nbsp;million related to our
	cross currency swaps was a reclassification adjustment included in net income in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	See &#147;Critical Accounting
	Policies&#148; below and Note 16 to the Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information on the key assumptions included in calculating the discount rate and expected return on plan assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Segment Analysis
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	We use earnings before interest, income taxes, and depreciation and amortization (&#147;EBITDA&#148;) as our measure of profitability for segment reporting purposes. This measure of segment operating
	results is used by our chief operating decision maker to assess the performance of and allocate resources to our operating segments. Intersegment eliminations and items that are not directly related or allocated to business operations are included
	in &#147;Other.&#148; For additional information related to our operating segments, as well as a reconciliation of EBITDA to its nearest generally accepted accounting principles (&#147;GAAP&#148;) measure, Income from continuing operations before
	income taxes, see Note 22,
<I>
	Segment and Related Information
</I>
	, to our Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	37

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	38
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Olefins and Polyolefins&#151;Americas Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
	&#151;In calculating the impact of margin and volume on EBITDA, consistent with industry practice, management offsets
	revenues and volumes related to ethylene
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	against the cost to produce ethylene. Volume and price impacts of ethylene
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	are reported in margin.
	Ethylene is a major building block of olefins and polyolefins and as such management assesses the performance of the segment based on ethylene sales volumes and prices and our internal cost of ethylene production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	EBITDA in 2016 reflects lower olefins and polyethylene results, partially offset by improved polypropylene
	results.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The benefit to 2016 EBITDA from a $57&nbsp;million gain on the sale of our wholly owned Argentine subsidiary in
	February 2016 was offset in part by a $29&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation charge recognized in the fourth quarter due primarily to a drop in polypropylene prices. In 2015, volatility in the
	benchmark prices for heavy liquids and natural gas and certain correlated products, particularly ethylene and propylene, which continued during most of the year, led to net
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation
	adjustments totaling $160&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Segment results were lower in 2015 primarily due to a
	decline in olefins results partially offset by improved polyolefin results relative to 2014. Olefins margins in 2015 continued to benefit from
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	low-cost
</FONT>
	ethylene produced from NGLs in North America, but to a
	lesser extent than in 2014. The cost advantage for this ethylene, compared to that produced from naphtha and other crude
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	oil-based
</FONT>
	liquids in the rest of the world, declined due to the lower crude oil prices
	in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Prices for heavy liquids, NGLs and olefins declined significantly in the fourth quarter of 2014 to levels that had
	not been seen in recent years. These declines resulted in the recognition of the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	LCM inventory adjustments totaling $279&nbsp;million in 2014 discussed below. As discussed above, results for 2015
	were also negatively impacted by a $160&nbsp;million LCM inventory valuation adjustment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Ethylene Raw
	Materials
</I>
	&#151;Benchmark crude oil and natural gas prices generally have been indicators of the level and direction of the movement of raw material and energy costs for ethylene and its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	in the
	O&amp;P&#151;Americas segment. Ethylene and its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	are produced from two major raw material groups:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	NGLs, principally ethane and propane, the prices of which are generally affected by natural gas prices; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#149;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	crude
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	oil-based
</FONT>
	liquids (&#147;liquids&#148; or &#147;heavy liquids&#148;), including naphtha, condensates, and
	gas oils, the prices of which are generally related to crude oil prices.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Although prices of these raw
	materials are generally related to crude oil and natural gas prices, during specific periods the relationships among these materials and benchmarks may vary significantly. In the U.S., we have significant capability to change the mix of raw
	materials used in the production of ethylene and its
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	to take advantage of the relative costs of heavy liquids and NGLs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Production economics for the industry have favored NGLs in recent years. Although the decline in oil prices significantly reduced the cost of ethylene produced from heavy liquids in 2015, NGL prices also
	declined and they have continued to be preferred feedstocks. We produced between 87% and 90% of our U.S. ethylene production NGLs during the past three years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	39
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	EBITDA
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2,877
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3,661
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	3,911
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;Revenues decreased by $887&nbsp;million, or 9%, in 2016 compared to 2015 and by
	$3,984&nbsp;million, or 29%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Average sales prices for ethylene and
	polyethylene declined in 2016, consistent with feedstock prices that are correlated to the price of natural gas, which declined relative to 2015. These lower average sales prices led to a revenue decrease of 11% in that period. A 2% revenue increase
	resulted from the improvement in 2016 product sales volumes as higher olefins sales volume, supported by an increase in the level of purchases for resale during turnaround activities, were only partly offset by lower polyolefins volumes. The sale of
	our Argentine subsidiary reduced 2016 revenues by $230&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Average sales prices
	declined for most products in 2015 resulting in a 31% revenue decrease compared to 2014. Lower average olefin prices reflect the significant decline in prices for crude oil and correlated products relative to prices in 2014. The decline in average
	polyethylene and polypropylene sales prices followed the decline in the 2015 prices of their respective feedstocks, ethylene and propylene.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These decreases in revenues were offset in part by an increase in sales volumes, which gave rise to a 2% revenue increase in 2015, compared to 2014. Ethylene sales volumes were higher due to increased
	production reflecting higher capacity following the completion of the expansion-related turnaround at our La Porte, Texas facility during 2014 and additional production related to less planned and unplanned downtime at our Channelview, Texas
	facility. Polyethylene sales volumes improved in 2015, due to the completion of an expansion-related turnaround at our Matagorda, Texas facility in the first quarter of 2014 and continued healthy global demand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EBITDA
</B>
	&#151;EBITDA decreased by $784&nbsp;million, or 21%, in 2016 compared to 2015 and by $250&nbsp;million, or 6%, in 2015
	compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Lower olefin and polyethylene margins in 2016 were partially offset by higher
	polypropylene margins. The decline in olefins margins reflected a 2 cents per pound decrease in average ethylene sales prices and an approximate 4 cents per pound increase in the cost of ethylene production driven by lower
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-product
</FONT>
	prices and an increase in the cost of NGL feedstocks. Polyethylene margins declined 4 cents per pound from very high levels in 2015 as average polyethylene sales prices caught up with the overall decline
	in the cost of ethylene feedstock, after lagging feedstock cost declines in 2015. A 4 cent per pound improvement in 2016 polypropylene margins reflects the benefits of lower propylene feedstock costs and tight market conditions. These olefin and
	polyethylene margin impacts led to a 17% decrease in EBITDA during 2016. An additional 10% decline in 2016 EBITDA is attributed to the impact of lower volumes related to lower ethylene production during the turnaround and expansion-related
	activities at our Corpus Christi, Texas ethylene facility and a site-wide outage related to turnaround activities at our Morris, Illinois site.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These negative impacts were partially offset by a 6% increase in 2016 EBITDA primarily due to a $131&nbsp;million reduction in the unfavorable LCM adjustment recognized in 2016 versus 2015 and to the
	$57&nbsp;million gain on the 2016 sale of our Argentine subsidiary.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	The 6% decrease in EBITDA
	reflected a 24% net margin decline as lower olefin margins were partly offset by higher polyethylene and polypropylene margins. This decrease in margins was
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	40
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	offset in part by a 14% increase related to higher volumes and a 3% increase related to the $119&nbsp;million decline in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	charges related to
	the LCM inventory valuation adjustments discussed above. Improvements in our income from equity investments accounts for the remaining 1% increase in EBITDA during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Olefin margins declined in 2015 as a 19 cent per pound drop in the average sales price for ethylene outpaced the decrease in our cost of ethylene production. Lower NGL and heavy liquids feedstock prices
	in 2015 outpaced the decline in selling prices of our
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products,
</FONT>
	which resulted in the decrease of our cost of ethylene production compared to the prior year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Polyethylene margins reflected a 5 cent per pound improvement in 2015 as demand remained strong and decreases in the cost of ethylene
	feedstock outpaced lower average sales prices relative to 2014. Polypropylene margins, which increased by 7 cents per pound in 2015, benefited from lower propylene feedstock costs, which in part reflected the decline in crude oil prices, and higher
	average sales prices relative to propylene, driven by industry operating issues and increased demand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Sales volumes in 2015
	increased as compared to the prior year as a result of downtime and expansion-related activities in 2014 and the increased demand discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Olefins and Polyolefins&#151;Europe, Asia, International Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
<I>
	&#151;
</I>
	In calculating the impact of margin and volume on EBITDA, consistent with industry practice, management
	offsets revenues and volumes related to ethylene
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	against the cost to produce ethylene. Volume and price impacts of ethylene
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	co-products
</FONT>
	are reported in
	margin. Ethylene is a major building block of our olefins and polyolefins and as such management assesses the performance of the segment based on ethylene sales volumes and prices and our internal cost of ethylene production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2016 versus 2015
<I>
	&#151;
</I>
	Higher operating results in 2016 were largely the result of higher polyolefin margins, offset in part by
	lower olefins results and reductions in polyolefins volumes due to turnaround activity and unplanned downtime.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	EBITDA in 2016
	reflects the benefit of a $21&nbsp;million gain from the sale of our wholly owned Argentine subsidiary and $11&nbsp;million of gains from the sales of our joint venture in Japan and idled assets in Australia. EBITDA in 2015 included a
	$30&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation adjustment driven by a decline in the prices of naphtha and polyolefins.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Operating results in 2015 reflect improved results for our European polyolefins and, to a lesser extent, higher results for olefins and better results for our joint ventures
	that are accounted for using the equity method.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	At the end of the fourth quarter of 2015, lower feedstock and product prices
	resulted in market prices that were lower than the carrying value of our related inventories. Accordingly, we recorded a $30&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation charge related to olefins and
	polyolefins. This compares to the $44&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation charge related to olefins that was recognized in the fourth quarter of 2014 as a result of the declining price of naphtha.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	Ethylene Raw Materials
</I>
	&#151;In Europe, heavy liquids are the primary raw materials for our ethylene production. In
	recent years, we have sourced increased amounts of advantaged NGLs when the opportunity has arisen. In 2016, we continued to process advantaged feedstocks as market opportunities allowed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	41
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

	Table of Contents

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth selected financial information for the O&amp;P&#151;EAI
	segment including Income from equity investments, which is a component of EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_10"></A>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="76%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">

<TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="3%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="10" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM:1PX SOLID #000000">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<B>
	Year Ended December&nbsp;31,
</B>
</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	EBITDA
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	2,067
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1,825
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1,366
</FONT>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;Revenues in 2016 decreased by $997&nbsp;million, or 9%, compared to 2015 and by
	$3,627&nbsp;million, or 24%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	The decline in 2016 revenues comprises a
	7% decrease related to lower average sales prices, and a 2% reduction of sales volumes stemming from turnaround activities and unplanned outages.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2016, average sales prices for olefins and polyolefins fell following feedstock prices that declined in conjunction with the price of crude oil.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	The decline in 2015 revenues reflects decreases of 14% and 12% related to lower average sales prices and
	currency translation impacts, respectively. An increase in polyolefins volumes resulting from increased demand and higher operating rates, which was substantially offset by a decline in olefins volumes stemming from turnaround activities at our
	M&uuml;nchsm&uuml;nster, Germany facility and unplanned outages, was responsible for a 2% revenue increase in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In 2015,
	lower average sales prices for polypropylene were partially offset by higher average polyethylene prices. Decreases in feedstock costs in 2015 led to the decline in polypropylene sales prices compared to 2014. The increase in polyethylene prices in
	2015 reflect strong spread increases over ethylene, primarily in Europe.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EBITDA
</B>
	&#151;EBITDA increased by
	$242&nbsp;million, or 13%, in 2016 compared to 2015 and by $459&nbsp;million, or 34%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016
	versus 2015
</I>
	&#151;In 2016, higher European polyolefins margins stemming from declining ethylene and propylene feedstock costs outpaced falling product prices and led to an 11% increase in EBITDA. This margin improvement in 2016 was partially
	offset by a 2% decrease in EBITDA due largely to lower polyolefin volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A 3% increase in 2016 EBITDA is attributed to
	gains associated with the sales of a joint venture, idled assets and our wholly owned Argentine subsidiary, as well as the absence of the 2015 LCM inventory valuation adjustment discussed above. Income from our equity investments also led to a 1%
	increase in EBITDA in 2016 due to higher polyolefin margins in our European joint venture and strong operating rates in our Saudi joint ventures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Improved margins in all major product groups and the increase in polyolefins volumes described above contributed 42% and 4%, respectively, to EBITDA in 2015. Polyolefins
	margins improved due to supply constraints as a result of several industry outages. Olefins margins improved in 2015 as the lower cost of ethylene production, which was driven by lower feedstock prices, outpaced the decline in olefin product prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A 4% increase in EBITDA associated with an improvement in Income from equity investments in 2015, was mainly driven by
	improved margins relative to 2014 in certain joint ventures as a result of favorable market prices during 2015 and strong operating rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	These increases were partially offset by a 13% decrease due to the translation of a weaker euro and a 3% decrease related to a net charge of $38&nbsp;million discussed below. In 2015, EBITDA included a
	$30&nbsp;million charge related to the LCM adjustment previously discussed. In 2014, EBITDA included a $52&nbsp;million benefit associated
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	42
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	with a settlement for certain existing and future environmental claims under a 2005 indemnification agreement from an insurance settlement, which was offset in part by the $44&nbsp;million LCM
	inventory valuation charge discussed above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Intermediates and Derivatives Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Operating results for 2016 were lower than in 2015, as margin compression for most products related to
	declining energy prices, higher industry production rates and additional industry capacity was only partly offset by the impact of higher volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	EBITDA in 2015 was negatively impacted by the recognition of $181&nbsp;million of LCM inventory valuation adjustments driven by the continued decline in prices for feedstocks, certain oxyfuels and related
	products, and intermediate chemical products to levels that were lower than the carrying value of our related inventories at reporting dates throughout the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014
</I>
	&#151;Results in 2015 improved as higher margins in intermediate chemicals benefited from the favorable impact of product pricing and declining feedstock costs. This improvement was
	substantially offset by a decline in 2015 oxyfuels and related products results indicative of a decrease in energy prices compared to unusually high margins in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Our 2015 results were also unfavorably impacted by the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation adjustment discussed above, which reflects an $88&nbsp;million increase
	over the LCM inventory valuation adjustment recognized in the fourth quarter of 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth selected
	financial information for the I&amp;D segment including Income from equity investments, which is a component of EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	1,333
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1,475
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	1,459
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;Revenues for 2016 decreased by $546&nbsp;million, or 7%, compared to 2015 and by
	$2,358&nbsp;million, or 23%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Lower average sales prices in 2016
	reflect the impacts of lower crude oil, lower gasoline prices and the decline in various feedstock prices. Additional industry supply also negatively impacted the average sales prices for certain products during 2016. These lower sales prices in
	2016 were responsible for an 11% revenue decrease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	This price driven decrease was offset in part by a 4% volume-related
	revenue increase in 2016 resulting from fewer planned and unplanned production outages relative to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus
	2014&#151;
</I>
	In 2015, the significant decline in crude oil and key feedstocks prices was the primary driver behind the overall decrease in average sales prices across most products. This decline in prices was offset in part by improved octane blend
	premiums for oxyfuels and related products and gasoline price spreads over crude oil that were strong in 2015. These lower average sales prices and the impact of currency translation impacts led to revenue decreases of 23% and 6%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage46"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Higher sales volumes for oxyfuels and related products and intermediate chemicals were
	largely responsible for a 6% volume driven revenue increase. Sales volumes for oxyfuels and related products increased due to strong octane and gasoline demand. Intermediate chemicals volumes increased due to increased feedstock supply and improved
	operating rates at our acetyls facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EBITDA
</B>
	&#151;EBITDA decreased by $142&nbsp;million, or 10%, in 2016 compared
	to 2015 and increased by $16&nbsp;million, or 1%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Lower margins in
	most I&amp;D products in 2016 resulted in a 30% decrease in EBITDA. Weaker gasoline markets drove oxyfuels and related product values lower relative to butane feedstock costs, and lower product prices in propylene oxide and derivatives and
	intermediate chemicals were driven largely by increased industry supply. Lower income from our equity investments in 2016 also resulted in a 1% decrease in EBITDA during that period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	An EBITDA increase in 2016 of 9% related to the higher volumes discussed above, partially offset the negative margin impact. EBITDA in
	2016 also reflected an increase of 12% related to the absence of the LCM inventory valuation adjustment recognized in the 2015 comparison period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	EBITDA increased by $16&nbsp;million, or 1%, in 2015 compared to 2014. Higher sales volumes in 2015 as discussed above led to a volume-driven increase of 7% in EBITDA.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Lower oxyfuels and related products margins, substantially offset by an improvement in intermediate chemicals margins
	resulted in a 1% decrease in 2015 EBITDA. Oxyfuels and related products margins were lower in 2015 due to a significant decline in crude oil prices offset in part by strong gasoline price spreads over crude oil and octane blending value. Margins for
	intermediate chemicals improved as styrene margins were favorably impacted by tight supply resulting from industry outages and feedstock prices that declined more rapidly than average sales prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	EBITDA was further reduced by 6% as a result of the $88&nbsp;million incremental increase in the
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation adjustment recognized in 2015 over 2014. The remaining change in 2015 EBITDA is attributable to a small improvement in income from our equity investments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Refining Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Lower margins and reduced production due to planned and unplanned outages in 2016 as described below resulted
	in significantly lower results for our Refining segment in 2016 as compared to 2015. EBITDA in 2015 included charges totaling $177&nbsp;million related to
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	charges associated with LCM inventory
	valuation adjustments driven by a decline of nearly $20 per barrel in crude oil prices and corresponding reductions in refined product prices.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	The results of our Refining segment in 2015 were impacted by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash
</FONT>
	charges totaling $177&nbsp;million related to LCM inventory
	valuation adjustments described above which were $167&nbsp;million less than the LCM inventory valuation adjustment recorded in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Fourth quarter 2015 results declined significantly compared to the results in the prior three quarters of 2015 as refinery operating rates were significantly lower due to unplanned maintenance outages.
	The recognition of a $127&nbsp;million
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	non-cash,
</FONT>
	LCM inventory valuation adjustment resulted in a loss for the fourth quarter. Operating results were higher in 2015 relative to 2014 as a result of improvements
	in refining margins and the favorable impact of the lower LCM adjustment recognized in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	44
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage47"></A>

	$

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	14.04
</FONT>
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;Revenues decreased by $1,422&nbsp;million, or 22% in 2016 compared to 2015 and by
	$5,153&nbsp;million, or 44%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Major refined product prices declined due
	to lower crude oil prices and to weakness relative to crude oil. The average per barrel price of benchmark Maya crude oil declined $7.59 in 2016 compared to 2015. A 16% price-related revenue decline in 2016 versus 2015 reflected per barrel price
	declines of approximately $10.51 and $10.77 for gasoline and distillates, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The remaining 6% revenue decrease in
	2016 is attributed to reduced processing rates. Processing declines resulted from several unplanned outages, including a coker unit fire, downtime at crude units with reduced processing and several utility interruptions. Planned turnaround activity
	on a crude unit and a coker unit processing train early in 2016 also contributed to lower throughput during 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015
	versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	Total revenues decreased on significantly lower product prices due to the drop in crude oil prices and a reduction in sales volumes due to production limitations. The average crude oil price in 2015 declined by slightly over $40
	per barrel compared to 2014 leading to lower product pricing. This decline in product pricing caused a 38% decrease in revenues compared to 2014. Processing rates in 2015 reflect an 8% decrease from 2014 rates, driven by processing limits which were
	negatively impacted primarily by unplanned maintenance in the fourth quarter of 2015. This decline contributed to a 6% decrease in 2015 revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EBITDA
</B>
	&#151;EBITDA decreased by $270&nbsp;million, or 79%, in 2016 compared to 2015 and decreased by $277&nbsp;million, or 426%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	A decline in refining margins in 2016 led to a 90% decrease in EBITDA. The Maya
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2-1-1
</FONT>
</FONT>
	benchmark refining spread declined in 2016 by approximately $3.10 per barrel relative to 2015. This decrease was driven by per barrel declines of approximately $3.15 and
	$3.40 in gasoline and diesel spreads, respectively, and an approximate $1.00 reduction in the price differential between Brent and Maya crude oils. The operating issues that drove lower crude throughput in 2016 also negatively impacted margins due
	to a less favorably priced crude oil mix and higher variable costs per barrel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Lower production stemming from a reduction in
	average heavy crude oil processing rates relative to 2015 led to a decrease in EBITDA in 2016 of 41%. This reduction in rates was attributable to the unplanned outages, crude unit operating limitations and planned turnaround activities discussed
	above.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	45
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage48"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The absence of the $177&nbsp;million LCM inventory valuation adjustment recognized in 2015
	resulted in an EBITDA increase of 52% in 2016 as compared to 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	LCM inventory valuation
	adjustments of $177&nbsp;million and $344&nbsp;million were recognized in 2015 and 2014, respectively. This change in the 2015 LCM inventory valuation adjustment resulted in a 257% increase in EBITDA. Results improved by an additional 283% in 2015
	due to an increase in refining margins. These improvements were offset in part by a 114% decline in EBITDA due to lower processing rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The increase in refining margins in 2015 relative to 2014 was generated by improved
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	by-product
</FONT>
	price spreads to crude oil and a 14% increase in purchases of crude
	oil at advantaged prices relative to the Maya crude price benchmark.
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	By-product
</FONT>
	spreads improved due to the decline in 2015 of the average per barrel price of crude oil relative to 2014. These factors more
	than offset the $2.13 per barrel decline in the Maya
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	2-1-1
</FONT>
</FONT>
	benchmark margin in 2015 versus 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Crude processing rates in 2015 reflect an 8% decline relative to 2014. This decline is mainly due to a number of unplanned outages for
	maintenance that began in the latter part of the third quarter and extended into early December. The average crude processing rate for the fourth quarter of 2015 was 206 thousands of barrels per day. Processing rates returned to near full capacity
	by
<FONT STYLE="WHITE-SPACE:NOWRAP">
	mid-December
</FONT>
	2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Technology Segment
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Overview
</B>
	&#151;The Technology segment recognizes revenues related to the sale of polyolefin catalysts and the licensing of chemical
	and polyolefin process technologies. These revenues are offset in part by the costs incurred in the production of catalysts, licensing and services activities and research and development (&#147;R&amp;D&#148;) activities. In 2016 and 2015, our
	Technology segment incurred approximately 55% of all R&amp;D costs while in 2014, it incurred approximately 65% of our R&amp;D costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	EBITDA in 2016 improved with higher catalyst margins. A small increase in licensing and services revenue was mostly offset by slightly lower catalyst sales volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	EBITDA in 2015 was relatively unchanged compared to 2014, reflecting improved catalyst results
	and lower R&amp;D expenses, offset by lower licensing and services revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following table sets forth selected
	financial information for the Technology segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
	&#151;Revenues increased by $14&nbsp;million, or 3%, in 2016 compared to 2015 and
	decreased by $32&nbsp;million, or 6%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	Higher average catalyst sales
	prices and higher revenues recognized on process licenses each led to a 2% increase in 2016 revenues. These increases were partly offset by a 1% revenue decrease resulting from lower catalyst sales volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	The unfavorable currency translation impacts due to the significantly weaker euro versus the U.S. dollar and
	a decline in licensing and services revenues contributed 12% and 7% to the decrease in 2015 revenues. These declines were offset in part by revenue increases of 12% and 1%, respectively, related to higher catalyst sales volumes and higher average
	catalyst sales prices in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D341907D10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	EBITDA
</B>
	&#151;EBITDA in 2016 increased by $19&nbsp;million, or 8%, compared to 2015 and
	by $11&nbsp;million, or 5%, in 2015 compared to 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2016 versus 2015&#151;
</I>
	A 10% improvement in EBITDA during 2016
	due to higher catalyst margins and an increase in licensing and services revenue was partly offset by a 2% decrease in EBITDA resulting from lower catalyst volumes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<I>
	2015 versus 2014&#151;
</I>
	EBITDA increased by $11&nbsp;million, or 5%, in 2015 compared to 2014. Improved catalyst volumes and margins, partly offset by unfavorable currency translation impacts, and
	lower R&amp; D expenses were responsible for increases in EBITDA of 7% and 9%, respectively. These increases were partly offset by an 11% decrease in EBITDA due to lower licensing and services revenues.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
